Campus police work here 24/hrs a day 365 days a year. They are local police and campus police to ensure campus safety.
Greek life is great there are over 26 Fraternity and Sororities currently acknowledged by the school including mine, Phi Delta Theta. There is definitely enough groups to choose between
There are tons of Clubs and Activities on IUP's campus just look on iup.edu to check them out

In the Fall and the Spring usually around 2:30-3:30pm this preacher comes in the Oak Grove to preach and he has gained a reputation as the Oak Grove preacher and you must show your appreciation by saying amen evey time you pass him.

Truthfully the school is truly amazing!!! and I am not just saying this because I go here I appreciate everything this school has to offer and I think if any prospective students would come visit they would fall in love with the school like I have

There are many things on campus to do. There are various types of Fraternities and Sororities to join, Intramural sports, or renting out the TV lounge with your buddies and having game/movie nights with friends.

I must admit, even though I do not live on campus I still find myself in the cafe everyday enjoying various types of food in the main cafe or even a midnight snack like pizza or subs in Folgers dinning hall.

The dorms are all apartment like suites even though I my self do not live on campus I must admit they are still pretty nice from a recent 12 million dollar renovations on all of the dorms and academic building

Some people find collage hard but it all goes back to time management. I am a student athlete and with the proper time management between school work and social life and athletic I found time to still manage a 3.1GPA
One tip for prospective students is to manage your time wisely. There are numerous amounts of time I have seen students get a C or fail because there was a lack of time management.
Out of a 10 I would rate IUP a 10. Out of all the students I have met here and the staff everyone is really friendly and really makes this place feel like home.
pageTitle: Indiana University of Pennsylvania (IUP) Reviews: Student Reviews and Ratings | Cappex
TableContextTimeStampAfterTable: {632415=It's affordable. That said, you may have to take out loans if you do not get sufficient financial aid (this happens especially if you live in on-campus housing). My loans have averaged $1000 per semester. Also, the quality of education will depend on the department/major you are in. The Education department and Nursing programs have notable and excellent programs, while some others are very lacking in terms of instructor quality and rigor., 700862=© 2015, Cappex.com, LLC, 10966=Expect cold weather in October, but mostly expect amazing unity. The IUP campus is big and holds 14,000 students, but you feel so involved when you are here. Whether you join the paper or just play frisbee with friends in the Oak Grove, you will see how unified the students are.}

textAfterTable: Great for these types of students Great for all types of students, especially education majors! Bang for the buck It's cheap compared to other schools in Pennsylvania. What to do for fun You could go hang out at Indiana Mall or Walmart. There are also some interesting stores along with the Jimmy Stewart Museum on Philadelphia Street in downtown Indiana. Food and Dining The quality of the food depends on where you go. Fosters Dining Hall's food isn't so great, but it is buffet style. The HUB (our student union) has a make-your-own pasta and salad places along with a hamburger place, Chick-Fil-A, and a sandwich shop. Folgers Dining Hall has a pizza place, a wrap station, oriental food, home foods, Quiznos, and Starbucks. You can used meal swipes at most places and flex to cover the rest. Dorm Life The suites are brand new! You can have your own bedroom, the kitchens are furnished with a microwave and mini-fridge, and you have a bathroom located in your suite. You are spoiled at IUP as far as dorming goes. Academic Rigor
